name: Antwerp Universal Exhibition 1894
obverse: Bust of Leopold II facing right.
reverse: A globe surrounded by a ribbon and a branch. Below the globe is Antwerp with the Cathedral of Our Lady  and the exhibition building visible. Above the globe is the coat of arms of Antwerp. The continents of the globe are labelled: AFRIKA, AUST, EUROPA, AZIA.
reverse_inscriptions: EXPOSITION UNIVERSELLE D’ANVERS 1894 WERELDTENTOONSTELLING VAN ANTWERPEN
description: This medal was made for the Universal Exhibition held in Antwerp in 1894.
